results.title: Chiapas Army Base occupation (Mexico) Jan 1, 2001
results.brief_description: This astounding testimony to ‘the power of the people’ was given to the Memory Grid Community Collection as part of the SKA TV video compile ‘Global Insights 4’, a collection of shorts from around the world with a focus on grass-roots peoples’ action. Chiapas Army Base (Mexico) was filmed by Big Noise Tactical (USA) a not-for-profit, all-volunteer collective of media-makers around the world, ‘dedicated to circulating beautiful, passionate, revolutionary images.’

results.title: Chiang Mai: northern capital
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, John Morris, Thanom Soongnarata and Brian Hannant
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian Neighbours: Thailand”.
In Chiang Mai, Thailand’s northern capital, many traditions and crafts have remained unchanged for hundreds of years. This film looks at the native handicrafts, including the production of silver jewellery, lacquerware utensils and silk-weaving. We take part in a colourful festival which marks the end of the Buddhist Lent. Through the day and into the night we see the solemn religious ceremonies, and the carefree carnival, complete with fireworks

results.title: Chi: the breath of life
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Bernice Daly
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Healers quacks or mystics”.
In this episode, Nevill Drury visits the Oki East-West Centre to investigate disciplines which draw on eastern thought and philosophy for new directions in health care. “Chi” is the Chinese word for breath of life, an inner energy. The Chinese believe it is the source of remarkable power, so the ability to control this energy is vital for a healthy and happy life. In a healthy person, the “Chi” flows smoothly, integrating body, mind and spirit, but in an unwell person there are blockages, or imbalances. The techniques demonstrated include Oki Yoga, Tai Chi, Shiatsu (with Bruce Gyngell as the patient), macrobiotics and acupuncture.

results.title: Cheyenne autumn
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Bernard Smith and John Ford
results.brief_description: This is the last and perhaps best Western directed by John Ford, featuring a stellar cast including Richard Widmark, Karl Malden, Sal Mineo, Edward G. Robinson and James Stewart as the light-hearted, quick-fingered Wyatt Earp. A small band of Cheyenne Indians attempt to escape from their barren Oklahoma reservation, over 1,500 treacherous miles to their own lush Wyoming lands, from which they were transported after surrendering to the army in 1877. Nominated for an Academy Award for Best Colour Cinematography, this is a beautiful and powerful film that stunningly combines a profound and passionate story of the mistreatment of American Indians with some of the most magnificent and energetic Western lore ever put to the screen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Warner Bros Pictures, Bernard Smith and John Ford

results.title: Chester: a portrait of a city
results.creator_credit: Granada Television International, Jim Clark and Ray Gosling
results.brief_description: A sceptical young man investigates Chester - its history, architecture, institutions, day-to-day life. After walking its streets, travelling its river and canals, talking to its people, the young man is converted.

results.title: Chess moves
results.creator_credit: David G Productions, Nick Mangay and David G. Hillier
results.brief_description: Compilation of video clips featuring songs composed by Benny Andersson, Bjorn Ulvaeus and Tim Rice for the musical “Chess”. Introduced by Tim Rice, the original artists Murray Head, Bjorn Skifs, Elaine Paige and Barbara Dickson perform the songs: “One night in Bangkok”, “Nobody’s side”, “The Arbiter”, “I Know him so well” and “Pity the child”.

results.title: Chess fever
results.creator_credit: Mezhrabpom-Russ, Vsevolod Pudovkin and Nikolai Shipovsky
results.brief_description: A chess fanatic is in danger of losing his lover because of his obsession with the game. This is a fast-paced short comedy, filmed during a Moscow tournament and featuring a gallery of world champion chess players. Pudovkin, though committed to the Bolshevik aesthetics predominant in 1920’s Russian cinema, was also a fan of early American comic cinema and the influence of Hollywood shows in much of the exaggerated action in “Chess Fever”. While the absent-minded hero of the film debates choosing between love or chess, his forever suffering girlfriend finds herself trapped in a city where everyone seems to be playing chess. This video version of this silent classic has a new soundtrack especially composed for the film in 1993 by Roger White.

results.title: Chess
results.creator_credit: Salam Ziusudras, Film and Television Institute (WA) and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: A humorous documentary style film with a dark edge to it about a refugee filmmaker’s transition from the brutality of the detention centre to adjusting and adapting to the Aussie way of life, fashion and culture. Contains disturbing images. Written, directed and produced by Salam Ziusudras

results.title: Cheryl and Kevin
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Timothy Read and Michael Thornhill
results.brief_description: Cheryl and Kevin are a young couple who have married before either was ready for the experience. Depicts and provokes thought about one of the major social problems to emerge from modern society and the changing values of young people.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia, Timothy Read and Michael Thornhill

results.title: Cherry Falls [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Rouge Pictures, Marshall Persinger, Eli Selden and Geoffrey Wright
results.brief_description: Australian director Geoffrey Wright made his American debut with this skewered take on the teen slasher film. Set in the quintessential American small town, “Cherry Falls” takes the convention of horror movies that only virgins can escape the killer’s knife and turns it on its head. When an unknown predator starts murdering teenage virgins, the town sheriff, (Michael Biehn) who has a teenage daughter of his own (Brittany Murphy), calls a general meeting amongst the concerned parents to combat the problem. The town’s teenagers however come up with their own solution; a ‘lose your virginity party’. Meanwhile, the body count rises, parents become delirious with fear and the kids get more and more frisky. “Cherry Falls” eventually descends into familiar formula but along the way offers some subversive moments like a father encouraging his young daughter to ‘go all the way’ with her boyfriend and father daughter relationships that are laced with incestuous desire. Cast includes: Jay Mohr, Candy Clark.
